To learn more about the drug court model, go to https://nij.ojp.gov/topics/articles/overview-drug-courts. If you or someone you know is struggling with addiction, Washington Recovery Help Line is a good place to start: https://www.warecoveryhelpline.org/

Nationally, these courts save up to $13,000 for every individual they serve and return as much as $27 for every dollar invested. They treat the participant as a whole person, addressing housing, education, medical and mental health needs, and employment.

Thank you to Chelan County Superior Court Judge Kristin Ferrera and everyone else who joined the conversation. Drug courts like this one are proven to increase public safety, reduce recidivism, and save public dollars.

Unlike private lenders, RUS doesn't easily allow its borrowers to refinance their debt when lower, more favorable interest rates come up in the market. There are very few circumstances that give businesses this flexibility, and even then, they face huge penalties. #VA07

The RUS (Rural Utilities Service) lends to rural utility service providers. Think electric co-ops, telecom businesses, etc. @RappElecCoop, @SouthsideEC, and @MyCVEC are all RUS borrowers in #VA07, and thousands of customers depend on them for electricity and internet access.

I'm cosponsoring the Flexible Financing for Rural America Act, a bipartisan bill that would allow @USDA RUS borrowers (like electric co-ops and small internet providers) to refinance without a big penalty. Here's what that means for #VA07 ‚Äî https://spanberger.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=3253
